docs.title: Summary
docs.text:
Looper is a module that allows you to easily loop functions without having to worry about lag or debounce. Leave regular while loops in the past with this more efficient module.

Creating a loop is as simple as: 

--Assuming the looper module is within ReplicatedStorage
local looper = require(game:GetService("ReplicatedStorage").Looper)
local loop = looper.loop(function() 
    print("Loop Ran")
end, 0)

Breaking a loop is as simple as: 

local loop = looper.loop(function() 
    print("Loop Ran")
end, 0)

loop:Break() --This breaks the loop

With looper you can disable/enable a loop without ever having to break it! 

local loop = looper.loop(function() 
    print("Loop Ran")
end, 0)

loop:TurnOff() --This disables the loop
loop:TurnOn() --This enables the loop

docs.title: - loop(function, delay)
docs.text:
Creates a new loop 

--Example
local createdLoop = looper.loop(function() 
    print("Hello World!")
    --This function repeats every 5 seconds
end, 5)

docs.title: - createdLoop:Break()
docs.text:
Breaks the loop and deletes it 

--Example
local createdLoop = looper.loop(function() 
    print("Hello World!")
    --This function repeats every 5 seconds
end, 5)

createdLoop:Break() --This breaks the loop

docs.title: - createdLoop:TurnOff()
docs.text:
Disables the loop without breaking it 

--Example
local createdLoop = looper.loop(function() 
    print("Hello World!")
    --This function repeats every 5 seconds
end, 5)

createdLoop:TurnOff() --This enables the loop

docs.title: - createdLoop:TurnOn()
docs.text:
Enables the loop

Info

This only works if the loop was disabled with the loop:TurnOff() method

--Example
local createdLoop = looper.loop(function() 
    print("Hello World!")
    --This function repeats every 5 seconds
end, 5)

createdLoop:TurnOn() --This enables the loop

docs.title: Version 1
docs.text: • Only current version, the first ever looper module

docs.title: Breaking a loop after 5 seconds
docs.text:
local loop = looper.loop(function()
        print("Hello World!")
    end, 0)
wait(5)

loop:Break()

docs.title: Enabling a loop after 5 seconds
docs.text:
local loop = looper.loop(function()
    print("Hello World!")
end, 0)

wait(5)

loop:TurnOn()

docs.title: Disabling a loop after 5 seconds
docs.text:
local loop = looper.loop(function()
    print("Hello World!")
end, 0)

wait(5)

loop:TurnOff()

docs.title: Simple Countdown
docs.text:
You can easily create a countdown with this code: 

local countdown = 30
local loop = looper.loop(function()
    countdown -= 1 
    print(countdown)
end, 1)

docs.title: Instance Counter
docs.text:
Print the amount of instances in your game at all times 

local instanceCount = 0
local loop = looper.loop(function()
    instanceCount = #game:GetDescendants()
    print(instanceCount)
end, 0)

docs.title: Ball Spawner
docs.text:
Spawn a ball every 30 seconds
local loop = looper.loop(function()
    local ball = Instance.new("Part")
    ball.Shape = Enum.PartType.Ball
    ball.Size = Vector3.new(5,5,5)
    ball.Parent = game.Workspace
end, 30)

docs.title: Method 1 - Grab the model
docs.text:
1. Grab the Looper Model by KashTheKing
  2. Open the toolbox and navigate to Inventory -> My Models
  3. Click ZonePlug to insert into your game and place it within ReplicatedStorage
